intro: Acmella poliolepidica, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pattypan, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in moist, sunny habitats. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance. The species is also used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
